intro: Escobariopsis pilispina, commonly known as the woolly cushion lichen, is a foliose lichen belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly thallus that appears as a cushion or mat, often with a pale green to yellowish-green color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae, which provide nutrients through photosynthesis. It typically grows on rocks, soil, or bark in temperate and subtropical regions. Escobariopsis pilispina is often used in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
